channel.title: Models
channel.description: Well i created the model with the DatMaker and the metasequoia and everything. Now i just need some help getting the code to add to my class8. I made D claws. I was wondering if i could get some help in how to make that code, or get it using the model. This is my first custom item so help is much appreciated.

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @EatU4Dinner EatU4Dinner
item.description:
@EatU4Dinner wrote:

how do i get the item number for item.cfg?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

well all i did was create the model using the programs listed above, zipped the model, then added it to the model section. then when i spawn the item i get this like block of white thing, then when i wield it they appear as iron claws or something.

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @deershoot3r deershoot3r
item.description:
@deershoot3r wrote:

ok you want to make a model number it can be anything but it cant be taken and can be up to 5 characters long an example would be 15987 and then also make up an item number thats not taken i use the same item number as the weild model number so its easier. and i forgot to mention when you go into your server type add model ##### (replace the ##### with your model number) and you have to add the drop model number and the weild model number, if you get lost tell me and illl try to help.

Read full topic

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

so like when i created my model, that model number?

Read full topic

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @deershoot3r deershoot3r
item.description:
@deershoot3r wrote:

ok search for this in class8.java

class8.method203(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_183);

under that add this in

if(i == the item number) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anInt174 = dropped model number; //if you dont have a droped number put the weild number here class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.anInt181 = 1000; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 470; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 129; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = -1; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt204 = 28; class8.anInt165 = the weild model number;//male wearing class8.anInt200 = the weild model number;//female wearing class8.anInt204 = 28; class8.anInt175 = -1;//Unknown class8.anInt164 = -1;//Female arms/sleeves class8.anInt188 = -1;//male arms/sleeves class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Name of item";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "examine information".getBytes();//examin info }

then add the item number to your item.cfg then open item.java and search for

public static int body

and add the item number thereâ€¦the item number is the number you use to spawn the item

post back with any errors[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 16, 2009, 08:18:57 pm[/size][hr]fill in all the details in the class8 thing with your information like where it says item number put the item number, thats the number you use to spawn the item, and put the model numebr where it says to put them

Read full topic
